intro: Ptilotus humilis, commonly known as the silky centipede or ghost flower, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and delicate, pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with well-drained conditions. Its unique appearance and ability to survive in harsh environments make it a notable species in arid ecosystems. Ptilotus humilis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
